comments:
I20050610-0010, GTK+, x86-64.

During shutdown, I got an error in my log and was presented with a dialog.

FYI, this exception indicates that a part's widgets were disposed without ever
calling WorkbenchPartReference.dispose.

I need to see what was below that on the stack. Can you attach the entire stack
trace? (And if there was another exception immediately before this one in the
log, that may be relevant as well). 

The interesting bit was what caused the window to be closed.

The window was closed inside a finally block. I need to know if it was in the
middle of dealing with another exception (another exception may have prevented
the normal disposal code from running).

Do you have a workspace that can consistently reproduce this? If so, can you
back it up and send it to me?
I tried and tried to get it to happen again but was unable to, sorry.

I'm getting this pretty frequently when I'm using fast views. Don't have a reproducible test case, but I'll 
play around and try to find one.
I'm running OS X (Tiger).

lead to vote and put it in for RC3

I can't reproduce this reliably. Seems to happen more often when views are opened as fast views and 
perspectives are opened in their own windows.

I believe that this (at least the stack trace from comment 7) was fixed by the
patch to Perspective.java in bug 19079, and that it was fixed in RC2.
